Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: David M. Rosenhauer "Dave R."
Reviews.Content: I got the setup the next business day!  Probably helps that I'm only about a 3 hour drive from the shipper.  Hooked it up and initially thought it was DOA.  But it wasn't the DVR comes locked and you have to hold the REW key for 5 sec to unlock the mouse and remote.  I got it on the network and through the router (NAT) in just a few minutes.  It's very easy to setup.  The Android software from Zmodo's website didn't work.  But in the tech section it recommends IP Cam Viewer by Robert Chou from the Android Market, it works great.  Just add a DVR, make=zmodo Model=Zmodo H9106 w/Media Port and all should be good. Repeat for each of the channels you use on the DVR.  There is also a version available from Amazon [...] but it's not updated as often.  I've only used the ActiveX web software so far on the PC.  It came with a mini-CD with software but I haven't installed it yet.Now for the bad.1. No Macintosh support (but it does have iOS support).  I contacted Zmodo and got a response within an hour!  They are working on Mac support but don't have a release date yet.  So if you only have Mac's or *Nix I would look elsewhere for now.  But if you have a Windows PC it's easy to setup and works great.2. Hard drive was loose in the DVR!  When I unboxed it I could feel something sliding around in the DVR.  I pulled the cover off and the Hard Drive was just sitting in there.  It was hooked up to the cables but no screws.  There's even a sticker that tells you where to install the screws.  In the bag with the remote and manuals there was a tiny bag with the 2 missing screws.  I installed them fired it up and everything was OK.  I guess they come from china without the hard drives and whoever installed it was in a hurry.  It came with a Western Digital Blue series Hard Drive (not the AV series as far as I can tell) but I'll have to look again at the exact model I got.If the Hard Drive wasn't loose in the DVR then it would have had a 5 star review.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money!
Reviews.Author: Eric W
Reviews.Content: I bought this because my car has been broken into 3 times in less than 2 months. If I had the money, I would obviously be living in a better neighborhood. Therefore, I was looking for something cheap yet effective!No HDD(SATA) was a perfect savings for me since I had a couple drives laying around. The framerate is pretty great on the cameras. Switching from color to IR is quite seamless. The GUI isn't the sexiest out there, but it does the job well. To save some head-scratching for others, when you first power up, go straight to the "alarms" menu. I turned off HDD, Motion, and I/O alarms to stop the incessant beeping. Then go to "device" to format the HDD. NTFS and FAT32 apparently are not what it is looking for. Email notifications and web-access are surprisingly brilliant for a system that is this cheap.So whether you need to catch the person that is stealing your garden gnomes, or you are filming Paranormal Activity 4 (creepy glowing eyes), it's a pretty good deal! Wish me luck on catching the bad guys!

Reviews.Title: Decent low end model, cameras could be better
Reviews.Author: J. Sabellico
Reviews.Content: I decided to pick up this kit mostly for the DVR, and figured the cameras would be a bonus...I was right.  The cameras are ehh in quality.  They dont have great night vision and sometimes during the day the picture greys out, but the DVR is excellent, and the software is simple, and intuitive.I'd buy this kit again, and supplement with better cameras. DVR is superb!

Reviews.Title: ZMODO DVR with Cameras
Reviews.Author: aptpath
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying my new DVR with cameras. Hook up was easy but I have done this a few times; however, the instruction sheets shipped with the product were so small that 5 people could not read the print or see the figures. I have yet figured out how to connect from my mobile phone and I hate calling tech support, but I may have to. I would recommend this product to all who do not want to spend big bucks.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for :-)
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting great things, so I'm not too disappointed.Most of the reviews here on Amazon concerning Zmodo equipment are accurate.The cameras are pretty low quality. They don't capture color correctly. Right now my cameras think green leaves and green grass are supposed to be shades of pink and purple. I'm not sure why this happens. It captures most colors correctly and it can't be corrected with hue settings. The problem exists at the cameras and nowhere else.If you expect to read a license plate on a car, think again. I have one of my cameras right now facing a cars rear end, roughly 20 to 30 feet away. The license plate is impossible to read. I actually tried holding up an old license plate in front of one of my cameras. 10 to 15 feet max. Beyond that the large letters of a license plate are illegible. That should give you some idea of what to expect from these cameras. Faces also become unidentifiable blobs at a distance. One of my cameras points to my front door, and it's close enough that I can identify someone I know. If it's someone I don't know, I won't have much luck finding out who it is, and the camera isn't going to represent the correct color of their clothing either. Not going to help much if the video gets turned over to the cops.At some point I will have to upgrade the cameras.The includee wire seems like a good deal, but take a good look at what you get. We have video and power all in one very small jacket. The size of the wire inside that jacket is probably very small and I bet it's stranded. Won't take much to break so you need to be very careful when pulling your wire. I managed to pull mine without breaking, but I am experienced in pulling wire. At some point it's probly going to make more sense to pull new coax with BNC connectors and use the existing wire for power only. Especially when upgrading cameras. We will see how the wire holds up over time.The DVR itself isn't so bad. The software is a little wonky but for a home DVR it is acceptable. As long as it holds up over time I think the DVR may be the best part of the purchase. I believe the DVR might be capable of recording a higher quality of video than what the included cameras can provide.My DVR also came with a USB mouse. It has some spare pieces clanking around inside... so that's going in the trash. I also received a remote for my DVR. I have not attempted to use the remote yet.All in all this is not a terrible DVR/camera system. I would recommend it more for indoor use considering the limitations of the cameras. If you need real outdoor surveillance, you will need better cameras.

Reviews.Title: Nice.
Reviews.Author: Anonymous User
Reviews.Content: Cheap. SERIOUSLY. I priced around and this was the cheapest w/HD. My friends still trip out about the price for two reasons:1) it INCLUDED the HD.2) 8CH not a 4CH.Great. Wish the resolution was better at night, but it's great all around.

Reviews.Title: worked great right out of the box
Reviews.Author: Tanya
Reviews.Content: Hooked this system up for our shop yesterday, and it worked great straight out of the box.  We also purchased four other Zmodo wide angle cameras for inside, and they all connected great.  Quality was plenty fine for what we were looking for, and even the infrared view after you turn the lights out is good.  I know some reviewers said that they had hooked the cables backwards, I'm not sure how.  If you manage to hook these cables backwards you have more problems than just that, probably also have trouble tying your shoes, as there was only one way to hook them up.  Also, some reviewers said that the menu is not very intuitive.  I've used several security systems over the years, and all the menus are kinda laggy and slow, but this one is about as easy to use as any.  Main menu, camera views, date/time setup.... not that hard to figure out!  At least I thought.  Anyway, for the price it can't be beat.  We haven't hooked up to the internet yet, so I can't review that part of the system.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good System
Reviews.Author: Junior111
Reviews.Content: I bought this system a few months ago. It was relatively easy to set up and I found out that you have to first format the build-in hard drive to keep it going. I played around with different settings, including 'masking' portions of a camera view in order to prevent excessive motion alarms. However the system is so sensitive that a tree swaying in the wind can trigger alarms, and I turned that function off.The cameras that came with the system are not the greatest, especially at night, but I knew that before I bought the system. For those areas which are important to my safety and security I bought some 600TVL CCD (NOT CMOS!!) cameras with at least 36 IR LED's and those are perfectly fine for  good night vision pictures.I never hooked the system up to any internet connection, so I have no expertise about these functions. But as a stand-alone system with 8 cameras it is a great system for the price.  If you can't decide whether to buy a 4 or 8 camera DVR - take the 8 camera version. The price is virtually the same but with the option of having up to 8 cameras installed you will at least feel more of in command when you just look at your live 8-split screen and KNOW where  'that awful noise" came from on the outside. When it comes to ANY cameras you use - spiders LOVE the IR lights and start adorning it with their webs. Make sure you have a long-handled feather-duster to keep the cameras free of cob-webs or it defeats its purpose of seeing who is out there.  The ONLY vulnerable part of the entire system are the cables that come with the included cameras. They are very thin and are easily damaged to the point of uselessness. DON'T staple these cables with a powerful stapler. I first taped the cables along their route to the camera to fit their length and then used appropriate plastic cable-holders to keep them in a fixed position. After that is done (takes some time) you can sit back and relax. Once the system is up and running with an upgraded set of good cameras you will wonder how you ever got along without it before. Besides - it really gives you peace of mind to go back in time on any camera angle and see for sure who stole your garden gnomes at 3:41 a.m.All in all - I'm happy with the system and would very much recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Expected to pay more
Reviews.Author: JudoYodan
Reviews.Content: This system went in and fired up relatively easily. It blows away our previous system, at half the cost. The mobile ap is AWESOME!Thinking of taking this one to my house and upgrading to the 16 cam unit for the biz.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected
Reviews.Author: WiseOne
Reviews.Content: I was unsure of what this would be like after reading reviews. For the price this is great! I didn't expect perfect at the price I paid.  Lets say I got this because we have unsavory rental neighbors & this is added protection. Its a decent picture & night vision is okay.It would identify people for sure & has a wider picture scan than as stated in a previous review.  You will get a large area with every camera.  The system itself is wired which is what I wanted. To view on the internet - NOTE (This is not wireless it will need to be hard wired to view on the internet.) If you want audio, you need to buy additional cameras. Zmodo told me no kits have any sound. For those 2 reasons, it only gets 3 stars instead of 4.UPS delivered it to the people we want our property protected from. We were lucky to get this package at all. The company should request signature confirmation on items like this.I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy!!
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: Had the system for 2 yrs now and it works great!  The cameras wer kind of cheap, not that great of color, so i upgraded to new larger cameras and the unit is working flawlessly. good buy.

Reviews.Title: Zmodo!
Reviews.Author: Forbesky
Reviews.Content: I work in security, I monitor the camera system several hours a day. When I order the Zmodo I was not expecting it to work as well as it does. From the ease of hooking the cameras up to programing them to my needs was a surprise. My house is very small so I didnt need to buy any extra wiring but anyone living in a large house should consider buying the extra, suggested, wiring.

Reviews.Title: Nice...
Reviews.Author: ios.art
Reviews.Content: not much to say about this one, quick to install, easy to connect and view from my computer & phone

Reviews.Title: Love it! Works Great!
Reviews.Author: SGT Cahue
Reviews.Content: I've had it for 5 months, running 24-7 and i have not had any problems! Being a typical male, I disregarded the instructions it came with and just started playing around with the system.. If you can program a VCR or Cable Box.. You’ll get this one right away.. If not have your kids give it a try.. I’m sure they’ll get it..

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Dallas Rivera
Reviews.Content: It works good. The video set up is a little slow but it will get the job done. I would invite anyone who is looking for a security cameras to get these. all you really need is a laptop for the software.

Reviews.Title: A lot for the $
Reviews.Author: Teambott
Reviews.Content: We installed the unit indoors where teens spend time after-school in a private 2,000 sq ft room away from another 33,000 in the same facility. We have extra ports on the facilities main DVR system but it was less money to install this stand alone unit then run wire from the main unit. Up and running for 30 days, working as intended.

Reviews.Title: Still running strong!
Reviews.Author: Kirby Coggin
Reviews.Content: This is a great DVR. Plenty of hard drive space. Hooks to the internet to watch remotely. I love them. The cameras are not the greatest at night but for the price this set up is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: Ongoing review
Reviews.Author: GogginGuy "gogginguy"
Reviews.Content: (First blush) Just recieved my package and wanted to let new users know that the quickstart guide in the packaging is for the 4-ch version, which is identical to the 8-ch version except the backpanel components in the manual will show only 4 camera I/O interfaces, not 8.  The unit which came was (correctly) the 8-ch DVR.  More reviewing to come...

Reviews.Title: Zmodo Security DVR
Reviews.Author: Al Salazar
Reviews.Content: This product more than exceeded my needs at home. As an electronics technician, I install and maintain security DVR systems on a regular basis so I can honestly compare the Zmodo to a commercial Honeywell system that costs 20 times the amount!I would say the value alone receives a five star rating, the functions and video quality are exactly the same or maybe even slightly better than the commercial Honeywell. The only downfall is the night vision, it does not illuminate quite as well as I would like, but then for the price, it’s unbeatable! Just spend a little more on better quality cameras for areas that you’ll need in dark areas. Other than that, the daytime quality is just as good as most I’ve seen.Setup is easy, instructions are pretty simple and they offer customer support if you need it.I would recommend this security camera system to anyone who needs a home system or business for that matter. Very satisfied customer!Regards,Al

Reviews.Title: It does what its meant to do
Reviews.Author: Rafael Arteaga
Reviews.Content: Nice item.. Kind of hard to get it up and running, configuration is not that easy... At the end its working ok...

Reviews.Title: Zmodo  8 channel DVR and 4 cameras what a great deal!!
Reviews.Author: Wayne L.
Reviews.Content: Good unit for the money.Pros:- Low cost the best deal around- Internet accessible with Android app- Easy setupCons:- Cameras have narrow angle of view- Camera motion sensor is very sensitive

Reviews.Title: very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Larry E. Mcgarr
Reviews.Content: This product was not as discribed.  Tech support did not know the anwser to a simple question.  Cameras could not see in the dark, when the bad guys are likely to strike.  There was only 1 power cord for all four cameras IE they would all have to be in one place, not helpful if you want to cover 4 sides to a building.  Directions were not that user friendly.  The box the cameras came in was cheap cardboard but came in ok shape.  This system is only good if you want to "see" in the daytime.

Reviews.Content: I am still trying to assemmble this item. the instructions is not that simple. after not being able to fix it myself I had to call in a professional to fix it for me he to is having a difficult time trying to figure out why the product is not coming on.

Reviews.Title: This company is a piece of s***
Reviews.Author: James Han
Reviews.Content: I would give this company a 0 star rating if I could, but I can't so I gave 1 star.The company Zmodo, and PC-rush are both horrible companies. I don't suggest any business to be done with them. I can't say Zmodo is the worst, but I know PC-rush is the worst company I have ever done any business with.  They constantly promise a call back every evening, but I have not gotten a call back for two evenings and I have constantly had to call back.  The product seems okay, but the seller is horrible. I will also be writing a review for the seller as well and bringing down hell during that review.
